title: Robotics and IoT-Based Language Education Design: Interdisciplinary Project-Centered Learning Through a Social Science Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational understanding of robotics/IoT concepts, proficiency in digital device usage, basic principles of language education, and basic awareness of multicultural educational environments
context.additional_context: A learner group comprising engineering and foreign language majors collaborates to develop language learning solutions applicable to real educational environments (including learners from diverse cultural backgrounds), with a focus on strengthening instructional design competencies that account for social interaction and cultural elements.

learning_goals: Interdisciplinary project for designing a language-learning game based on intercultural communication themes using robotics and IoT technology.
Building a customized language education environment combining educational robots with physical objects and cultivating the ability to reflect multicultural learners’ needs.

Learners identify at least three educational design conflict cases (e.g., cultural bias, misaligned learning goals, tech-pedagogical priority conflicts) arising when collaborating with peers from diverse academic backgrounds (engineering, humanities, social sciences, etc.). They establish at least two conflict-resolution strategies (communication protocols, role-distribution criteria, cultural context considerations) and propose a plan achieving ≥80% participant satisfaction in simulated collaboration scenarios.
Prototyping and evaluating IoT-based educational content reflecting actual language learners’ needs (social context, cultural background, etc.).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
